channel.title: ABS Brakes are shit
channel.description:
Recently I had my ABS brakes "fixed" in my 2004 Chevy Blazer. Today i'm driving home from work and the abs light is blinking on and off randomly and the brakes are grinding. I stop turn off the vehicle, put it in park, and restart it. Same thing.
I come to the first stop sign I approach on the way home and when I press down the brakes the grinding continued and I didn't even SLIGHTLY get slowed down. So now i'm thinking what the fuck my brakes are obviously messed up. Restarted the vehicle again in hopes I can at least get home. I turn onto the last road before my house and the ABS light, and the Parking brake light both come on and entirely lock up my brakes. Slid into a ditch, hit a tree and continued sideways into a field.
Luckily I was only going 30 MPH at the time, but it still pisses me off that not even a month ago I had my brakes worked on. It pretty well fucked up my bumper, hopefully I can get this paid for by my insurance or the retarded brake service.

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

Got back my vehicle this morning, they defiantly wanted to keep my business. They fixed the 3 broken sensors (both front wheels and back left wheel), put on a different bumper, oil change, and a transmission clean. Charged me 27 dollars in parts. For the sensors I presume. So basically it all didn’t turn out so bad.

Read full topic

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I misread the button on my dash below the VSA off button. It says AFS off not ABS off, AFS is active front lighting system. Maybe most cars dont have an option to turn off abs.

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Most cars can turn off ‘traction control’ or ‘stability assist’, but I’ve never seen one that could turn off ABS. (though most of my cars don’t even have ABS! or only in the rear! :))

when I had a grand am it had the ability to turn off ABS

Read full topic

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m saying I don’t know if they actually did do anything wrong. Sometimes things like sensors and the like just go out, it’s not like they definitely would have known it was bad a month ago. To me it just sounds like they are trying to do right by you to keep your business, either way they could have told you it wasn’t their problem, so it just seems like a good place to me.

Read full topic

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:384090”][quote author=maniown link=topic=479846.msg3515837#msg3515837 date=1298982952]

Most cars can turn off ‘traction control’ or ‘stability assist’, but I’ve never seen one that could turn off ABS. (though most of my cars don’t even have ABS! or only in the rear! :))

ABS is an all time thing, Its not like you can just “turn it off” or you wouldn’t have any brakes.

Word back from the car shop, the sensor was bad on my front right tire and caused it to lock up. They’re fixing everything for free, new bumper, fixing brakes, ect… I’m not sure I really want them fixing my brakes again…
[/quote]

That’s awesome, I figured they would tell you it’s your problem and not their fault the sensor went bad. Sounds like a good shop to me.[/quote]

They usually do pretty good with my other problems. But they “fixed” these brakes not even a month ago. They admitted to doing something wrong, and said they’d fix it for free.

Read full topic

Begin epic quote pyramid

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

ABS increases stopping distance, but it allows you to keep control.

I have owned my toyota for 10 months, done like 15,000km and the only things I have had to do is replace the clutch (was f’ed when I bought the car), replace some tires (were fairly crap when I got them), and give it oil changes. Brakes are mint, suspension is a bit tired, gearbox is a little noisy in a few gears - requires double clutching, motor runs like new. I say they car is pretty good for having 312500km and being 24 years old.

Read full topic

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It sounds like it has nothing to do with ABS brakes, it sounds like whoever ‘fixed’ your brakes didn’t fix them correctly.

[quote=“jme, post:2, topic:384090”]I got new rotors and brake pads recently. He ordered the rotors from somewhere, and I supplied him with ceramic brake pads. I had ceramic brake pads on before and they were quiet, but this time when he installed them they were horribly loud. I waited a few weeks to see if it would go away and it didn’t, so the garage put on some silicone pads for free. Well then I dont know what they did, but I drive away from the garage and my NEW rotors are warped and the pads are louder then ever. He replaces the rotors for free, again, then of course they are fucking warped within a week and he’s not willing to fix it this time. So I went through 2 sets of rotors and brake pads, within a few weeks.

Unrelated to your topic, but I felt like ranting too. All I want are some working brakes. I shouldn’t have to pay a lot of money, have them fail twice, and then not even get a refund afterwards. There’s only like 1 or 2 saab dealers in Canada, and they are way too far away from me.[/quote]
There is a specific break-in procedure you have to follow with ceramic brake pads (supplied by the manufacturer of your brake pads), or they will squeal like a pig and warp your rotors, regardless they are very loud for the first 500-1000 miles, you just have to deal with it.

Read full topic

item.title: ABS Brakes are shit
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I got new rotors and brake pads recently. He ordered the rotors from somewhere, and I supplied him with ceramic brake pads. I had ceramic brake pads on before and they were quiet, but this time when he installed them they were horribly loud. I waited a few weeks to see if it would go away and it didn’t, so the garage put on some silicone pads for free. Well then I dont know what they did, but I drive away from the garage and my NEW rotors are warped and the pads are louder then ever. He replaces the rotors for free, again, then of course they are fucking warped within a week and he’s not willing to fix it this time. So I went through 2 sets of rotors and brake pads, within a few weeks.

Unrelated to your topic, but I felt like ranting too. All I want are some working brakes. I shouldn’t have to pay a lot of money, have them fail twice, and then not even get a refund afterwards. There’s only like 1 or 2 saab dealers in Canada, and they are way too far away from me.

Read full topic
